com.novartis.opensource.yada.util

Class QueryUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.novartis.opensource.yada.util.QueryUtils

  • public class QueryUtils
extends Object
    Utilities for query string manipulation and accounting.
    Since:
    0.4.0.0
    Author:
    David Varon

      This method creates a list for positional-indexed storage of data values, then iterates over the list of jdbc-parameterized columns, extracting the corresponding values from the data map.

    • Method Detail

      • getAdaptorClass

        public Class<Adaptor> getAdaptorClass(String source,
                             String version)
                               throws YADAResourceException,
                                      YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException
        Retrieves the adaptor class from the application context given the parameter values.
        Parameters:
        source - the JNDI string or url mapped to the query's app in the YADA index
        version - the version of the framework, for selection of the proper adaptor
        Returns:
        the Class of the appropriate adaptor
        Throws:
        YADAResourceException - when source can't be found, or there is an issue with the application context
        YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException - when the adaptor class mapped to source can't be found

      • getAdaptorClass

        public Class<Adaptor> getAdaptorClass(String source)
                               throws YADAResourceException,
                                      YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException
        Parameters:
        source - the JNDI string or url mapped to the query's app in the YADA index
        Returns:
        Class of type Adaptor mapped to the source
        Throws:
        YADAResourceException - when source can't be found, or there is an issue with the application context
        YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException - when the adaptor class mapped to source can't be found

      • getAdaptorClass

        public Class<Adaptor> getAdaptorClass(YADAQuery query)
                               throws YADAResourceException,
                                      YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException
        Parameters:
        query - the query object to process
        Returns:
        Class of type JDBCAdaptor mapped to the source string stored in the YADAQuery object
        Throws:
        YADAResourceException - when the source stored in query can't be found, or there is an issue with the application context
        YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException - when the adaptor class mapped to the source stored in the query can't be found

      • getAdaptor

        public Adaptor getAdaptor(Class<Adaptor> adaptorClass,
                 YADARequest yadaReq)
                   throws YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException
        Returns an instance of adaptorClass using the "YADARequest" constructor.
        Parameters:
        adaptorClass - Class of type JDBCAdaptor mapped to the source string stored in the YADAQuery object
        yadaReq - request config
        Returns:
        an adaptor instance of the provided class, with including the service parameters
        Throws:
        YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException - when adaptorClass cannot be instantiated

      • getAdaptor

        public Adaptor getAdaptor(Class<Adaptor> adaptorClass)
                   throws YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException
        Returns an instance of adaptorClass using the no-arg constructor.
        Parameters:
        adaptorClass - the class name of the YADA adaptor associated to the query
        Returns:
        an instance of the provided class
        Throws:
        YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException - when the adaptorClass cannot be instantiated

      • getAdaptor

        public Adaptor getAdaptor(String source)
                   throws YADAResourceException,
                          YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException
        Calls getAdaptorClass(String) to get the class, then getAdaptor(Class) to get an instance, using the no-arg constructor.
        Parameters:
        source - the JNDI string or url mapped to the query's app in the YADA index.
        Returns:
        an instance of the adaptor class mapped to source
        Throws:
        YADAResourceException - when source is not mapped to an adaptor
        YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException - when the adaptor class cannot be instantiated

      • isSoap

        public boolean isSoap(Class<Adaptor> adaptorClass)
        Returns true if the adaptor class is SOAP_ADAPTOR_CLASS
        Parameters:
        adaptorClass - the class name of the YADA adaptor associated to the query
        Returns:
        true if the adaptor class is SOAP_ADAPTOR_CLASS

                           throws YADAParserException
        Utility wrapper method to manage Parser instantiation and parsing.

        yq - The query object containing the SQL to parse

      • processStatement

        public void processStatement(YADAQuery yq)
                      throws YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException
        Called when the CCJSqlParserManager.parse(java.io.Reader) throws a JSQLParserException Uses regular expression to infer the query type.
        Parameters:
        yq - the query object containing the code to parse
        Throws:
        YADAUnsupportedAdaptorException - when the adaptor can't be found or instantiated

        Parameters:
        yq - the query object in which to set the protocol attribute
        Throws:

      • requiresConnection

        public boolean requiresConnection(YADAQuery yq)
        Test if the query requires a stored connection
        Parameters:
        yq - the query to evaluate

      • isCommitQuery

        public boolean isCommitQuery(YADAQuery yq)
        Returns true if the YADARequest.PS_COMMITQUERY parameter is not null, has a length > 0, equals true, and the query type is equal to Parser.INSERT, Parser.UPDATE, or Parser.DELETE
        Parameters:
        yq - the query to commit
        Returns:
        true if the YADARequest.PS_COMMITQUERY parameter is not null, has a length > 0, equals true, and the query type is equal to Parser.INSERT, Parser.UPDATE , or Parser.DELETE
        Since:
        0.4.1.0

      • getCallableStatement

        public CallableStatement getCallableStatement(String sql,
                                     Connection conn)
        Creates and returns a CallableStatement from the sql on the conn.

        NOTE: not sure why this method isn't throwing an exception.

        Parameters:
        sql - conformed code (without YADA markup)
        conn - connection object derived from YADA query's source attribute
        Returns:
        the desired statement object

      • getPreparedStatement

        public PreparedStatement getPreparedStatement(String sql,
                                     Connection conn)
                                       throws YADAConnectionException
        Creates and returns a PreparedStatement from sql on the conn
        Parameters:
        sql - conformed code (without YADA markup)
        conn - connection object derived from YADA query's source attribute
        Returns:
        the desired statement object
        Throws:
        YADAConnectionException - when the connection cannot deliver the statement

      • getConformedCode

        public String getConformedCode(String code)
        Removes all YADA data type symbols from source code.
        Parameters:
        code - stored code with YADA markup
        Returns:
        the transformed code

      • getDataTypes

        public char[] getDataTypes(String sql)
        Parses the source code, generating a char array of data types in order of occurrence.
        Parameters:
        sql - stored code with YADA markup
        Returns:
        a char array of data types

      • setValsInPosition

        public void setValsInPosition(YADAQuery yq,
                     int row)
        This method creates a list for positional-indexed storage of data values, then iterates over the list of jdbc-parameterized columns, extracting the corresponding values from the data map. It then stores the value in the list at it's proper positional index. Finally, the indexed value list is added to the list of value lists in the query yq, at position row.
        Parameters:
        yq - the query containing the data to process
        row - the index of the data list

      • setQueryParameters

        public void setQueryParameters(YADAQuery yq,
                      int row)
        While processing JDBC statements, this method handles mapping of data values to JDBC positional parameters.
        Parameters:
        yq - the query containing the statement
        row - the index of the value list stored in the query

      • setQueryParameter

        private void setQueryParameter(PreparedStatement pstmt,
                     int index,
                     char type,
                     String val)
        Calls the appropriate setter method for type in the pstmt, performing the appropriate type conversion or syntax change as needed (e.g., for Dates)
        Parameters:
        pstmt - the statement to which to assign the parameter values
        index - the position of the parameter
        type - the data type of the parameter
        val - the value to assign

      • processInColumns

        public String processInColumns(YADAQuery yq,
                      int row)
        This method uses a variety of variables from yq to determine the number of jdbc positional parameters which must be included in the SQL in clause in the stored query. Once the parameter count is determined, the original SQL is amended with additional jdbc parameter placeholders (i.e., ?), and the amended SQL is stored in the yq.
        Parameters:
        yq - the query being processed
        row - the index of the list of value lists in the query containing the data to evaluate
        Returns:
        modified SQL code
